intro: Micranthes calycina, commonly known as the small-flowered sandwort, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cabbages, and is characterized by its small, white or pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils, often in open woods or along stream banks. It has a low-growing habit with numerous small, linear leaves and produces capsules as its fruit. Micranthes calycina is often found in moist, well-drained habitats and is a common sight in the understory of eastern forests.
